node.title: Australia, US and Japan to fund undersea internet cable in Pacific to counter rising Chinese influence
node.alt: Aerial photo of the bankrupt island state of Nauru
node.description: The governments of Australia, the US and Japan say the proposed cable will provide high quality and more reliable internet access to about 100,000 people.
node.content:
["Australia, the United States\u00a0and Japan\u00a0have announced they will\u00a0jointly fund the construction of an undersea cable to boost internet access in three tiny Pacific countries, as the Western allies seek to counter rising Chinese influence in the region.", "The three Western allies said they would develop the cable to provide faster internet to Nauru, Kiribati and the Federated States of Micronesia.", "However, the three allies did not specify how much the project would\u00a0cost.", "\"The proposed undersea cable will provide faster, higher-quality\u00a0and more-reliable and secure communications to approximately 100,000 people across three countries,\"\u00a0a joint statement from Australia, the\u00a0US and\u00a0Japan said.", "\"This will support increased economic growth, drive development opportunities\u00a0and help to improve living standards as the region recovers from the severe impacts of COVID-19.\"", "For island nations in the Pacific to access high-speed internet, they need to route traffic through one of the three regional hubs:\u00a0Sydney, Guam or Hawaii.", "In the statement,\u00a0Foreign Minister Marise Payne and the ministers from the other countries said the announcement was \"more than an infrastructure investment\".", "\"It represents an enduring partnership to deliver practical and meaningful solutions at a time of unprecedented economic and strategic challenges in our region,\" they said.", "\"This project builds on the strong foundations of trilateral collaboration between Australia, Japan\u00a0and the United States in the Indo-Pacific.\"", "
Regional security concerns behind internet cables
", "", "
Australia has a number of underwater cables connected around the region.(Supplied: TeleGeography)
", "The development of the undersea cable is the latest funding commitment from the Western allies in the telecommunications sector of the Pacific.", "It comes as the US and its Indo-Pacific allies are concerned that cables laid by China could compromise regional security.", "Beijing has denied any intent to use commercial fibre-optic cables \u2014\u00a0which have far greater data capacity than satellites \u2014\u00a0for spying.", "Back in 2016, the Solomon Islands government signed a deal with Chinese telecommunications giant Huawei to lay a cable to Australia.", "To push out the arrangement\u00a0Solomon Islands had with Huawei Marine, Australia\u00a0paid for most of the Coral Sea Cable, which\u00a0connects Port Moresby in Papua New Guinea and Honiara in the Solomon Islands to Sydney.", "That deal\u00a0cost Australia about $137 million.", "The contract for Huawei Marine would have led to a cable between Honiara and Sydney being laid, which would have meant Chinese hardware had been connected\u00a0to the backbone of Australia's domestic internet infrastructure.", "\"That was seen as a red line that Australia would not cross and so we jumped in with a better deal, providing the cable as a grant that would be implemented with a procurement partner of Australia's choosing \u2014 that wouldn't be Chinese,\" director of the Lowy Institute's Pacific Island Program Jonathan Pryke said.", "This was at a time when Australia had just banned Huawei from its\u00a05G and NBN networks.", "Huawei Marine also bid on the East Micronesia cable project\u00a0that would have seen Nauru, Kiribati and the Federated States of Micronesia connect, via several other cables, to Guam,\u00a0but the US reportedly had concerns about the Chinese firm's involvement.", "ABC/Reuters"]
